CatDescriptText: Miss Marvella Baines, 75 Sylvania Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 13, 1958, pg. 2, with question: �What do you think of young men or boys who process their hair? Do you think it improves their appearance or not?� Answer reads: �No, I think that it does not improve the appearance of the persons who wear them.  And personally, I do not like them, because they seem so silly.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Marvella Baines, wearing dark button down sweater, plaid dress, and eyeglasses, standing on Wood Street with trolley car, Downtown
